During this scene Arthur stood at his desk pretending to study, but glancing every now and then at Elsie, with a conscience evidently ill at ease. She cast an imploring glauce at him, as she returned to her seat; but he turned away his head, muttering, “ It's all her own fault, for she wouldn’t let me help her.'’

As he looked up again, he caught his sister Lora's eyes fixed on him with an expression of scorn and contempt. He colored violently, and dropped his upon his book.
